website_summaries.verdict: Upgrade your Amazon Fire TV and Alexa-enabled devices by adding the Recast. You will be all set to stream, record, and watch some of your favorite live programs.
pros: Amazon Fire TV's DVR system allows you to record up to 75 hours of programming
Can stream live local channels using an HD antenna
Compatible with Alexa devices for easy voice control
Easy to set up following the step-by-step instructions
cons: Requires the purchase of additional devices, including an HD antenna and Fire TV streaming device to make the most of its capabilities

website_summaries.verdict: The Amazon Fire TV Recast DVR makes it easier than ever to watch free live and recorded over-the-air TV without monthly fees.
pros: The Amazon Fire TV Recast antenna DVR doesn't charge any monthly fees
Its sophisticated program guide fits live TV channels seamlessly into the Fire TV interface
Setup is easy and out of home streaming to your phone works well
Picture quality was perfectly good and performance was more reliable than streaming live TV services
You don't need a Prime membership to use it, though that helps
cons: It's more expensive initially than many antenna TV options
You need a Fire TV device attached to your TV, and can only watch on two devices at once
Alexa search isn't as dependable as manually using the channel guide, and the required Fire TV menu system pushes you toward Amazon content

customer_reviews.title: Continuous buffering and video skipping
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed in this product. I tried two different boxes and had similar issues. Constant buffering, video breaking up and on screen messages that said my antenna signal was weak. The antenna message is very odd since I have a high end outdoor over the air (OTA) antenna that I use for my TV without any issues. There is also an issue with the audio and video being out of sync. I truly wish this product worked as advertised as I have been looking for a reasonably priced device to record OTA programs but this is not it. Amazon needs to improve their technology and R&D before I would buy or recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: JulieD

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for “prime time”
customer_reviews.text: Buffering ALL THE TIME, constantly pixelating and not really reliable. The idea is good but the execution is not there SORRY Amazon. Maybe later when you improve it.
customer_reviews.author: gshacienda

customer_reviews.title: Dud
customer_reviews.text: I received a lemon device. Everything set up fine until it scanned for channels. I initially tried an indoor antenna and got zero channels after scan. I moved the box and antenna to all four corners of my house and nothing changed. Then I tried an outdoor antenna that I had connected directly to an older TV with tuner that received over 39 channels. Nothing on the Recast. Disappointing to say the least. A replacement is on its way, hopefully no issues with that one. I'm sure refurbished Recasts will be available soon, the one I returned being one of the first.
customer_reviews.author: E. Seltzer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: If your guide doesn't show up you won't be able to record somebody from Amazon contacting me today and I asked him if they're going to fit the issue what a software update no he said the guide has to work to record so if it goes out all you're going to have is a paperweight cuz they won't fix the issue don't care about their customers buyers beware garbage
customer_reviews.author: The 1

customer_reviews.title: I give an F for customer support
customer_reviews.text: I discovered an unacceptable quirk with the Recast & amazon refuses to allow me to speak with their Recast development team. When setting a recording there is an option to extend the recording time. If you do so, I always add 60 minutes to live sporting events, the recording in not accessible between the end of the scheduled program & the end of the extra time (thus when it finishes recording). You can access the recording during the program's normal scheduled time but once the program is no longer available live you have to wait until the extended recording time is done before it shows up as a recording.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Limited to 720P Needs IOS Control
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy once I reinstalled the iPhone app. Was a bit disappointed that the resolution was limited to 720p. Hopefully this will change with a future firmware update. One cannot set it to record a program from your IOS device. So you have to be in front of your tv at home to do this. What an odd omission, especially in this “connected” age.
customer_reviews.author: David Springett

customer_reviews.title: Hardwire Recast
customer_reviews.text: If you want to have trouble free performance with Recast, ethernet hard wire both the fire stick and Recast. Amazon sells a hard wire ethernet convertor for the fire stick generation 2 and above, and I use a power line device with a switch for getting hard wire internet to both the Recast and fire stick by using the electricity wiring in my house.. Flawless performance, no buffering or picture degrading. This is the only way for guaranteed hassle free performance.
customer_reviews.author: J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have read the FAQ's before I pre-ordered, but buying a device that has 4 tuners it would just make sense I could watch on 4 Fire TV's at the same time, but no ONLY 2! I bought this to replace my 4 tuner OTA Tivo. It is not a replacement at all, it's a step backwards. Major bummer. Taking off a star for each tuner they won't let me use. (5 -2 = 3 stars)
customer_reviews.author: darqman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device with only few issues. See in review.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was very easy. DVR recording and playback are seamless. Integration with FireTV stick is awesome. The one issue I have is with a message that keeps comming up indicating "Weak or No Signal. try repositioning antenna to improve reception.". There does not seem to be away to shut this message off. Even when picture quality is good, the message pops up. I would like to be able to disable this message. Also a signal level indicator in the setup mode would be very helpful in properly orienting the antenna. Any help or suggestions would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: A2fly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This product did not take any of the channels that are normally given over antenna in my neighborhood. We could only find 9 channels so we had to return it
customer_reviews.author: Irisianas

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but trouble
customer_reviews.text: I was on the phone for over 15 hours with these people and I am on my second box. The first one kept going between excellent reception to no reception, and the second one jumps picture, doesn’t have synchronization with people’s words, has buffering problems etc. I am surprised this thing got through beta testing with all the immense troubles it has. I’m also shocked at the excellent reviews it has received. Multiple times I was told customer service would call me back and they did not. They said they would troubleshoot my device remotely and they did not. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mrcjking

customer_reviews.title: Cord cutters dream!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! No more running cords and antennas to your TVs. Just plug in a fire stick and you get live TV with a browse menu and no monthly fee! Plus it’s a DVR and will allow you to watch TV on all your devices including your phone. Picture quality is perfect! Go buy one at Bestbuy now!
customer_reviews.author: SuperTommyK

customer_reviews.title: Continuous, unnecessary popup ruins a good product
customer_reviews.text: I would give a 5-star review except for the stupid "Weak or No Signal" warning box that constantly pops onto the screen despite the fact that the picture and audio is great. I have moved the antenna and repositioned it to point to the towers. I still get a great picture but the stupid, continual warnings keep coming. There are blogs complaining about this for more than 6 months and Amazon has not fone anything. Fix this and I will change my review.
customer_reviews.author: BrianG

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The DVR portion of this WORKS GREAT, however, the TV Tuner section has a LOT to be desired. On the same antenna I have two other TVs and they pickup lots of channels. The recast tuner only sees about half of them (including the one I really wanted to record). I also wish there was a way to manually add/edit channels and the channel names recast assigns. Hopefully Amazon will get this figured out soon.
customer_reviews.author: Mudd

customer_reviews.title: Would not work on a wired network
customer_reviews.text: If you intend to connect this device to your wired network via the Ethernet port, it won't work. I prefer that all my devices are wired instead of using wireless. One reviewer mentioned a procedure used to get the Ethernet port to work and still it worked only for a while. If the Ethernet port isn't plug-and-play, it should at least be configurable. This product is a bad design not to mention that it only supports Amazon devices. I didn't want to pass up this discount but it looks like I'll have to find another product that supports both Amazon Fire TV and Apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: mxplea10

customer_reviews.title: Is my new uodated review different?
customer_reviews.text: I'd say yes.....its very different than my previous DVR. Is it better or worse? My TiVo was a no brainer.....best in it's class....bar none. The recast is better for the cable cutters....no monthly cost, but I've decided to put all my cards on recast. Why? It's young and I hope Amazon will listen to the users and adapt. It's NOT. inferior, but has a learning curve to overcome. I trust they will. Trusting big business is a chance, but I'll give them that chance. I'm not a Amazon fanboy at all, but they usually come thru. Hope they can make the changes to make the recast a truely break thru product. You listening? Amazon?
customer_reviews.author: oae83

customer_reviews.title: Poor reception compared to TiVo or tv
customer_reviews.text: The software interface with the fire tv is great, it i think the recast has issues with its tuner. Using the same antenna I used for my TiVo and the recast is receiving about 1/3 of the channels I was receiving. I have eve tested this by hooking up a tv to the same antenna and the tv is receive considerably ore channels as well. Hopefully amazon can fix this through a software update or in version 2 of the recast.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Adamczyk

customer_reviews.title: Rushed to market
customer_reviews.text: Rushed to market for the holidays. Concept good on paper but still buggy and needs work. Lack of options on IOS app such as delete recording, setup series record, future record, lack of guide. I agree with most of the other 1 & 2 star reviews that were written prior to today 11/21/2018 Do not pay more than $179 for the 500 gb model or $219 for the 1TB model as these are the prices as of this writing which are $40-$50 lower than the original price when released just 2 weeks ago on November 14, 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Shaq

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE:  Fuzzy DVR/OTA playblack.  Not the TiVo killer I had hoped for.  User Interface poor.
customer_reviews.text: This cant be real-but it is. Even over gigabit LAN which easily handle 1080 DVR playback is fuzzy. Records in 1080 should stream 1080 at least to local, well connected devices. It Doesn't . Also The TiVo interface is much better as well, which is surprising: Consider Amazon's true streaming advances like the X-Ray, predictable forward and back scanning, and other player features that are superior to its rival, Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: J Hill

customer_reviews.title: save me $7 a month for not a getting the tivo
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this November the 18th 2018: after having this for 8 months, if they would not have offered the TV guide for free I would have probably purchased the tivo. 14 days ago I lost 2 TV stations On the recast and I couldn't figure out What was wrong So I disconnected the cable from the recast and reconnected the TV's And reacquired the 2 channels that were Lost I cannot get any customer service to tell me why that would have happened except that my antenna might be bad Heard from amazon and as you expect its not their problem
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Twombly

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH MOST LOCAL PBS STATIONS
customer_reviews.text: After much frustration and much time on the phone with customer service and amazon recast technical help I found out that many local PBS stations do not have whatever agreement is needed to stream through the recast box. So tomorrow the box goes back. What a HUGE disappointment for me as this was the ONLY reason I got the box. I wanted to record the programs I cannot seem to stay up late enough to watch. Really bummed. AND I wish it had been clear right away that there could be such problems.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Consumer

customer_reviews.title: After one month the product still does not work correctly.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I like about this product. After one month the product still does not work correctly. The TV tuner is very poor quality which causes poor reception. Recorded playback will stop with a blank screen. Product should have taken 1 to 2 hours to install took one day to solve all the installation problems. Technical support was the worst ever since this new age of use people who don't know the product and provide useless information.
customer_reviews.author: Edward F. Blair

customer_reviews.title: Non Functional
customer_reviews.text: Amazon obviously designed this to be very simple to operate. Subsequently there is barely a trace of printed instructions. Have gone thru the online setup instructions for a week. Unit is not visible to the FireStick.
customer_reviews.author: Anon220

customer_reviews.title: Regret Regret Regret.  Why did I invest in recast???
customer_reviews.text: Failed experiment. So much happier with Hulu Live or You Tube tv. While it seemed on the surface that the investment in equipment would be cheaper in the long run, unfortunately I could not depend on the recast. Too often my recording would just go black at some point through the recording. Missed the end of too many programs. The firestick was so much slower than Roku and and many times had to recycle power on the whole system. Worked for hours with tech support and they decided I just didn't have a good enough antenna. Hmmmm - I don't think so.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: The almost perfect OTA solution.
customer_reviews.text: The tuners in this thing are amazing. The main reason I went to OTA was to get PBS which doesn't come with Hulu Live or YouTubeTV, but even with a rooftop antenna I couldn't get them in without breakups until I got this box. The integration with FireTV is great, and the picture is excellent, much better than you get with paid streaming or CATV. I wish you could bring up the grid on the phone app and use it to schedule recordings. Setup was absurdly easy, you don't even need to enter a wifi password, just hook up your antenna, plug it in and go. If you've been considering going to OTA, this is definitely the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: audiomagnate

customer_reviews.title: Lots of buffering for trying to watch live channels
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy, found stations without issue. Biggest issue was using it to watch one of the live channels. I stream stuff via plex and work from home, have the Netgear Orbi mesh system, and had this hard wired into the router, and would still get buffering that I dont experience using any of my other streaming sources. I've returned it for now, not quite there for being the solution I was hoping for. I really want something like the TCL Roku built in TV. Watch live tv or go to your apps all from one screen, but I prefer Amazon over Roku. I'll hang on until something new hits.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Sevening

customer_reviews.title: Amazon FAILS
customer_reviews.text: Device worked perfectly at first, then started having issues. I have spent SIX WEEKS going back and forth Amazon tech support. Everytime it gets to the point where they actually have to give me a fix, all the sudden they cant find the correct info on my case ID. It was great while it worked, but dont expect Amazon to do anything to help when it doesnt
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Shipers

customer_reviews.title: I keep hoping it will get better
customer_reviews.text: It lacks a standard way to project recording options for shows that are not currently live. I.e. if you're wanting to record next week's show of X, then X has to be currently broadcasting live and you can set it up to record next week (and subsequent weeks, etc.). However, if you want to record show X next Tuesday, but the shoe is not currently live, then there's nothing you can do. Personally, has not proven itself to be worth the cost yet. May consider returning if it's not too late...
customer_reviews.author: Gracili Pingue

customer_reviews.title: Endless connection issues
customer_reviews.text: Usually doesn’t work. Usually won’t stay connected to my router. I originally had it connected to my router via WiFi (both devices in the same room) and after having issues I ran an Ethernet cable from recast to router. Still the same issues. From the Fire TV App on my phone, Recast is reported as “connected” then “Disconnected” then “Unknown Network Connecting” in endless loop. The router has no trouble with any other device in my house, router is not the issue. All software and firmware is up to date.
customer_reviews.author: Judge

customer_reviews.title: Needs a reset every week
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Amazon refuses to remove the “weak signal” pop up that drives us all crazy. (Tried 11 different antennas, non work to receive the stations that are less tha 8 miles from me.) Have to power off at least once every week to regain function. Can’t delete shows- just get a warning that deletion failed.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant at first, but just amazing. Was running on the HDHomerun and using a separate Philo app. This combines it all into one guide and has a great UI. Definitely recommend if you are a cord cutter. Got the 1 TB drive for recordings. 1 time charge and free beyond that, streams across your Wi-Fi with the Firesticks. Have 4 TVs setup in the house. With the Philo app and the OTA antenna 105 channels in my area. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gallaher

customer_reviews.title: Inefficient and full of glitches. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with the Fire TV Recast. Besides Echo Auto for car, this device is the most inefficient and frustrating piece of garbage Amazon has ever put in the market. It's beyond slow, does not scan channels well, it conflicts with Fire Cube, slows down Alexa responses, etc., etc., etc. I could go mon and on with the bugs this device has. After almost a month of frustrations and stress caused by this piece of garbage, I returned it. I am now considering replacing Amazon for Google devices.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Really poor picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I just bought the Fire TV Recast, got it set up and have watched it live and recordings for two days. I am really disappointed in the low-def picture. When my antenna is connected directly to the TV the picture is clear and high definition (1080 p). Running it through the Recast converts it to a low definition picture. I was not aware Recast had that issue. I will most likely be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Wusname

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: When operated from a smartphone you can't record multiple shows for hours and hours. Say you want to binge watch 10 episodes of I love Lucy. If you miss the opportunity to program it ahead yes you can start to record once the show is begun but it stops at the end of each episode. It will not begin to record the next episode. I wanted to record 10 hours continuously of different shows. I had to manually start each recording and at the end of each show it stopped without me telling it to stop or keep going . It needs to have programmable start and stop times on the smartphone interface. To me it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Karl W. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly bad
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Prime Day special, finally got around to installing it. What a disaster. There's nothing good to say about the product; the UX is a trainwreck, streaming quality is terrible, the voice recognition integration is a joke. What they shipped is like a very early alpha, where they just had to get some kind of proof of concept out the door. It's not a real product yet.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the fire stick
customer_reviews.text: Does not improve channel quality or the number of channels. If the product is unplugged accidentally you have to start all over again to get it online register it Etc not worth the aggravation when you're trying to get a picture recast for also freeze up if it feels like you're recording too many programs at once
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a lot of work
customer_reviews.text: I liked all the bells and whistles but that is as far as it goes. For the price, you are a lot better off with TIVO TV. Does not skip over Ads like TV does. It is not as easy to find things as TIVO does. I hope when there are updates on this that they are free. The best part is, there is no monthly fee but I don't know for sure that takes the place of having a much better device in TIVO.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Such a headache
customer_reviews.text: I used to LOVE this thing! So much that I cut the cord. Now it is nothing but a headache. It is constantly having to be reset and not connecting to my network. I’m so over it. I’ve have this for about 10 months now.
customer_reviews.author: HannahE

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. love the channel guide and the easy recording. A must have for anyone that cuts the cord. It picks up/cleans up channels that are on the edge of the viewing area. It gives you a warning that it is a weak signal but the picture is very good. Works great with Fire TV and Alexa. The voice recognition issue isn't a problem with Fire Cast, Alexa or Fire TV; it's a problem of getting old and not talking clearly. Now if someone could fix that???
customer_reviews.author: family movie night

customer_reviews.title: Fire TV Recast a definite FAILURE!  Wait for the next update (or two)!
customer_reviews.text: Frustratingly painful device to try to set up. Over the telephone support is spotty. This device and our Alexa did not connect. Amazon has a lot to do to get these fire/Alexa devices to see each other and create a unified system! I have found that the Amazon brand components are very difficult to set while those of competitors are a breeze! If I had not received a firestick as a gift I wouldn't have ANY Amazon electronics!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Much better than TiVo
customer_reviews.text: Made the mistake of ordering a TiVo first. Two of the four tuners didn't work, and the two that worked did not work well. The Fire TV Recast was easy to set up, found more channels than my TV could, and is fairly intuitive to use. Immediately found and integrated external storage I had added. Tuner appears excellent, although it would be nice if I could turn off the pop-up box it displays when the signal breaks up. Incorporated Starz channels I had signed up for into the TV guide. Altogether well done for a new product.
customer_reviews.author: UncleShel

customer_reviews.title: Poor system with poorer support.
customer_reviews.text: When I connect the antenna to the TV the signal is strong and clear. When I view the same channel through the Fire it is often of poor quality and will not even record on the Fire Recast. The support is very poor. They offered me basic fixes that did nothing to help like tighten the connection or reposition my antenna that is large and fixed to the roof. Support said they would get escalate my issue and get back, but never did. When I called again they gave me the same old recommendations that I had already told them didn't help. I am sorry I bought it
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeSM

customer_reviews.title: Purchased when first came out. Recast is very poor
customer_reviews.text: It does record but it is hard to connect to TVs and Fire Tablets. Very hard to program. I have been a lifetime customer of TiVo since October 1999. Recast is very hard to set up programing to record. Once a show is recorded and viewed, it is very hard to erase past programs and the whole system keeps not finding the Recast Box which only one room away on any TV with either Fire Stick or Fire box. I would not recommend this for anyone except someone who is highly experienced in TV electronics.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cleu

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it, but poor image(720) quality and too many clicks needed to navigate
customer_reviews.text: My main broadcast channels are in 1080, but recast downgrades it to 720. I can really notice a difference, even with my midsize LCD tv. I've also had to restart the Fire Stick twice in a month. Navigating through the menus can get cumbersome and it's easy to make an erroneous selection. I like that you don't have to switch tv inputs, to go from streaming channels to live tv. But the menu driven system and poor image quality is a deal breaker. I do like how Alexa can turn on my tv, to the desired channel, with a simple command. Sad to say, I bought the new TiVo Bolt OTA and love it.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID K COINCON

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one year of disappointing results
customer_reviews.text: Buy something else! I love Amazon and most of their products. Every tv has a fire stick and I have multiple Alexa devices in my home. The recast device is a huge disappointment. The user interface is awful and the dvr often missed recodings. After struggling with this POS for 13 months, it just stopped working altogether. It won’t even power on now and the one-year limited warranty is up. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Kirbbdoggy

customer_reviews.title: Simple, elegant solution
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a DVR solution since i cancelled my Direct TV service. I tried a tuner connected to my laptop, but the interface was too clunky. I ordered a Recast and it arrived a day earlier than predicted. I had it hooked up and linked to my accounts within a few minutes. What could be easier than saying, "Alexa, record (name your show) and it programs the recording. It's completely integrated into the Amazon Fire TV interface I'm use to using. Even my wife, who dislikes almost anything tech related, likes the device. Five stars
customer_reviews.author: Tri_not_du

customer_reviews.title: Avoid like the plague!
customer_reviews.text: It constantly disconnects from the internet. I've rebooted numerous times and all my other devices are connected, no issue. On customer service for 20min to speak with a product specialist so far and NO HELP! FIRE RECAST is a special dept I'm told. I cant even return it unless customer service handles it. WHAT DOES CUSTOMER SERVICE DO?? TRANSFER ME TO THE SPECIALISTS THAT DONT ANSWER!!!!! It's only 2 STINKING WEEKS OLD!!!! IT SHOULD BE ELIGIBLE FOR A RETURN via the app. I spend $20,000+ on amazon a year! I'm on my second phone call with customer service and looks like another 20min on hold to nowhere!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can record over the air tv. There are some big drawbacks with this though. Through the ap you can't set recordings. I have to be on the fire tv stick to pull up a channel guide or to set recordings. You can put the ap on your phone and tablets but they're limited on functionality. It could be a decent product if they updated the software some. update: a lot of the problems I was having were due to my modem/router I guess... I got a new one and I've had almost no problems like I had been having. They still could use some improvements but I'm upping it from 2 to 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Schim

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: The recast is not worth it! I live in Chicago, 5 blocks from the sears tower (Willis tower or whatever). You would think the huge antennas on the tower or living in a highly populated area would give you better good reception. Nope! I would give zero stars if I were able too. I have tried three different antennas with the recast and the same result. I just wanted to make sure it was the recast and not the antennas before I wrote this review. Such a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Item returned with a week.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product the day it came out and returned it less than a week later. It dropped channels and recordings the day after I set it up. I tried factory resets, repositioning the antenna all around my house and nothing. The premise of this is great, just need to work their bugs out big time. Tech support told me to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: C&M Walker

customer_reviews.title: No setting option to turn off annoying pop-up
customer_reviews.text: The recast would be great however there is a pop-up that states “Weak or no signal” when the picture is perfectly fine. And it keeps popping up every 30 seconds or so. Sadly Amazon provides no way to turn it off. Until they provide an option to turn off that annoying pop-up, it gets 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Turd Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I thought i would cut the cord and get an Amazon DVR. This product is definitely not the way to do it. First, it only gets a few channels and I thought may be that is a function of the antenna. The second problem is that streaming is always buffering - it goes thru my FireTV and it seems to slow it down drastically. Third are the "upgrades" - it is constantly upgrading itself... in the middle of a program... at night... while recording... during playback. Utter nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: Xin Li, SEAS LLC

customer_reviews.title: Seems like an abandoned product
customer_reviews.text: You can see several reviews here dating from 2018, praising this product potential and pleading with Amazon to keep on working towards refining it and adding new capabilities. Two years later, there's nothing to report. The mobile experience in particular is an exercise in frustration; even using the best wifi, you'll be lucky to be able to watch more than 10 to 15 seconds of your show at a time without pausing 10 seconds to buffer -- and that's when you're lucky enough to have your recordings actually show up without force-closing the app or rebooting the Recast itself. Unless Amazon stops treating this product as if it was already obsolete, you have far better options.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pfitzner

customer_reviews.title: It will break quickly I’ve been through two.  Don’t waste time with this terribly designed product.
customer_reviews.text: Ideally this device would be great. The problem is they don’t work for long. I’ve been through two of these that have broken within two years. They warranties the first one but the second one broke just as quickly and I was told there was nothing that they could do to help. This device is obviously not ready for market. If you like hours on hold and then being told that there is nothing they can or will do to help, than this device is for you. This is obviously a flawed product and Amazon will not stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if yes or no.
customer_reviews.text: I hired a professional installer to handle the cord cutter situation. I paid them (Electronic Wizards) $800.00 to handle everything. I'm 82 & don't do ladders or roofs anymore. I had to order my EQ thru Amazon myself. When the EQ arrived they installed a roof antenna & 3 firesticks. one of my firesticks is bad & replacement should arrive soon. They arrived @ this solution after I did several checks over the phone. My system buffers often & fails when I try to record something important. I have $1200.00+ invested & wished I had stayed with my easy to operate cable.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Can't play to a computer
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to set up and use Easy to schedule programs One app to access streaming services and OTA DVR Cons: Can't play to a computer. That leaves me watching my sports on a tiny phone or ipad screen. Definitely not ideal. Why can't I stream this to my 28 inch iMac? Thinking about returning it. It's just not useful without being able to do a bigger screen. Yes, I can plug a fire tv stick into the TV, but then I have to take over the living room with sports, which nobody else likes.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Love it except for freeze on record see comments
customer_reviews.text: Love the device It still goes black when watching a recording and the next show to record wants to start. So you have to hit the back button and resume play. Many others having same issue per Google search. You say it's a software issue that has not been fixed yet
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye TiVo
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that takes some figuring out is calibrating an antenna. My parents watch over the air television and YouTube tutorials will say to simply max out the range. Wrong! You’ll want to set the range to a reasonable range for living in a metro area, 30 miles seemed to work best for my folks. Otherwise the tuner is trying to do more than necessary. Unless you’re pretty rural, you’ll get more with less range. 47 channels in the Minneapolis ‘burbs, plus DVR and all the other stuff included with the firestick.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Switched from TiVo and overall it’s good, although there is a list of improvements and some basics that should be there: 1) should record even if internet goes out using last known information 2) should allow recoding by specific times , not just beginning to end of program. 3) allow customization of home screen to get quick access to favorites 4) Access guide from home screen I’m sure there’s a few more things that can streamline the user experience and put it way ahead of TiVo.
customer_reviews.author: mhamilton

customer_reviews.title: Constantly offline, picture quality caries from device to device
customer_reviews.text: I have two Fire TV sticks and a Fire TV, the recast constantly goes offline and the quality of the picture varied from device to device. I have tried Ethernet and WiFi and it is a make no difference. The "fireTV" app is no help. The only positive is that it records TV shows, but it also records the buffering and poor picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: We recently cut off our satellite, and the only thing I was missing was the ability to record my local channels. Especially our local news shows, which we never watched live. We DVRed everything with the satellite . This solved it! I love it. I luckily caught it close to Prime Day for $100 which got me to order it. I have an outdoor antenna that picks up all the channels available in my area so along with our news we are able to watch a lot just from he antenna. Easy to set up and use. No problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Katzzz

customer_reviews.title: I love my Recast!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fire recast! I use a Mohu Sky 60 antenna with it and I get around 30 local channels the guide is sweet and all of my recordings have been perfect. I run this on a Toshiba Fire TV, a Firetv 3 and a 4k Fire stick. Easy set up with the mobile app too. I did have a few problems with lip sync at first but I connected to the 5ghz band on my router and it's been flawless since. I have my antenna upstairs and I put the Recast right next to it. Very handy. If you want your local channels on all your TVs with no annoying wires and a great VCR, get this unit!!
customer_reviews.author: VikingGuy

customer_reviews.title: Do your homework (research)... Amazon recast is very unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: A complex piece of equipment. I was extremely pleased with recast at the beginning. After 3 week's I could not keep a connection between my fire TV and the recast. Amazon sent me a replacement box but I'm reluctant to connect. Because the service is so bad, very unreliable. Honestly I wish I could get my money back I would purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Died within 32 days and bad customer experience
customer_reviews.text: After 32 days they won’t send a replacement. Now I have to ship it out for repair. Such bad experience. I will never buy another fireTV device again. Then when I got to support chat they offered to send a replacement but then I tried to set up the device again. It failed with error code 1055:200 so I reconnected to chat. The next guy said sorry no replacement I have to mail it out for warranty repair. I’ve lost all of my shows and with the disappointment of a failed device now I have to deal with mailing this thing in and waiting for a refurb.
customer_reviews.author: Hai Jinx

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a year and a half - Don't be a sucker
customer_reviews.text: Bought the expensive 4-tuner version. It died yesterday. Amazon would not replace, since warranty is only 12 months. They graciously offered a 15% discount if I wanted to buy a replacement. I said "No thanks." Don't be a sucker like I was. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Dushey

customer_reviews.title: no way to remove channels!!
customer_reviews.text: How can Amazon make such a big miss. There is no way to remove channels? I live near a major city and there are ~100 channels found,which is great. Not being able to exclude/remove channels is just ridiculous. even a Cheap TV tuner can do that.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J:

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My TIVO died and I asked around what would be a good replacement. I do not subscribe to satellite or cable, so just have local channels and streaming services. I never watch any "live" TV and so like to record shows to watch later. With this product I can use my firestick to see local programming and set recordings for any TV series I watch. One remote works it all for local TV, streaming, recording, volume, etc. Easy set-up for the most part even though I am not very technical.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: For a DVR without any monthly fee the Fire TV Recast is a pretty good deal for cord cutters. I use mine with an over-air antenna and pick up most of the local stations without issue. The places this unit falls down are the confusing interface and the lack of any ability to watch a recording while it is recording (for example watching 15 minutes behind live so you can skip commercials). If Amazon continues to update the interface they will have a really nice product.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Clark

customer_reviews.title: 2 months in....we're in love
customer_reviews.text: I wish the remote has a "guide" button to get me to the over the air guide quickly. That is my ONLY complaint. Otherwise, my super picky wife cant tell the difference from cable and the whole family is enjoying streaming far more than cable with constant commercials. Not counting the 2 streaming services we subscribed to, we are saving exactly $144 per month since dropping cable TV , their DVR and DVR service. Subtract Netflix and Hulu, we are still saving over $100 and do not miss cable TV one at all. (If I was a big sports fan I would miss cable more)
customer_reviews.author: Ringo

customer_reviews.title: Best Way to Distribute Over-the-Air TV Throughout the Home
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding product. Easy to setup, powerful tuners for weak signal areas, and nice integration with the Fire TV interface. I have used a 4-tuner Tablo DVR for many years, which is more versatile, but they've struggled with performance issues in the user interface and the time it takes to start streaming a channel. Amazon has made the perfect cord cutting product for those who use Fire TV.
customer_reviews.author: Toz

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in Amazon on this product. I’ve always had a great experience with products that I’ve purchased from Amazon, but not in this case. Nothing about this worked as advertised, the video quality was horrible (worse than standard DEF), pixelated and graining. Set it up for a season pass to record a few shows on NBC, and it recorded the wrong shows every time. When I tried to fast forward it just buffered, an never came back.
customer_reviews.author: Knks64

customer_reviews.title: Heads up Recast will not pair if both devices are ethernet connected.
customer_reviews.text: Recast won`t pair with my Fire TV Box when both are connected by ethernet connection. One of them needs to be WI-FI connected for them to pair.
customer_reviews.author: Not Satified

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: We just received the Recast today and so far so good. We bought the Home Run about 6 months ago and what a piece of crap. After googling reviews The Recast received the best reviews. And wish we had purchased the Recast First. Love the Recast and all the features work great.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Good but waiting patiently
customer_reviews.text: As others have said the user interface is lacking. The guide is nice, but as with all of these services they are not perfect. There needs to be a way to manually schedule a recording. I do like that you can select a series to record, but the new only appears to mean it has never been recorded. I selected a series and another channel had a marathon, so I had a lot of old episodes. I stopped this by hiding the channel, but there should be a way to limit what channel to record from.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Too flaky and needs daily reboot after owning for a few months 🥴
customer_reviews.text: Reboot, reboot. Bought this 5 months back and now for the last few weeks we have to reboot it EVERY DAY. It just stops responding. Of course the return window is closed as of July, do we’re SOL. Also, sometimes it lets us delete show episodes after viewing them and other times we have to reboot before it allows us to remove them. This is a KNOWN issue they wont address from 2 years running. I wouldn’t nuy. It again. Tooooo flakey.
customer_reviews.author: MTB rider

customer_reviews.title: needs work
customer_reviews.text: Device is nice but interface is very rube goldberg. You need both a fire tablet plus fire tv stick to use it, that makes no sense. I have a tivo, I prefer watching recordings on my computer, the recast has no such option that I found. I wanted the recast because I like stuff plus my tivo is old and need a replacement if it dies. Another problem I had is the new fire tv stick sucks compared to old one. I can't imagine thats it more then trival to move the interface into the recast and do away with the stick and tablet requirement. As a kid I think first principle was keep it simple.
customer_reviews.author: xyz55

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time putting the "required" antenna all over my house to only get 0 channels. This is not a choice to get rid of cable. Very disappointed again with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Great for cord cutters but it's still missing 1 key feature...
customer_reviews.text: Picture this... You are watching a show and a commercial comes on so you drop into the channel guide to see what else is on. Oh, oh. The show is back on and they are about to reveal who shot JR but.. how do you get back to full screen? Better be sure you knew what station your were watching or the name of the program because if you don't, you may miss the best part or worse, not be able to find the show at all. Suggested fix: The Play/Pause button should bring the preview window back to full screen, like it does in the Pluto TV app. Just sayin... It's been a year now..
customer_reviews.author: ContraAl

customer_reviews.title: The 2 Tuner is the one to get....
customer_reviews.text: You don't want the 4 tuner version unless you are just into recording a lot of local TV all at the same time. Three people in my household and everyone likes to watch something different. With either unit, the first two that connect are the two that get to watch the show they want, the third one is out of luck. They both only output to two devices and you can't get a second unit to work with the same account. Sort of useless in a lot of cases.
customer_reviews.author: Stilwell Review

customer_reviews.title: Buy one. Help them get started! U will love it and forgive it's shortcomings.
customer_reviews.text: Well designed, smooth interface using FireTV Remote. PRO:Most DVR functions are there. Pulls in TWICE the channels than my roof antenna alone! CON: Video quality varies from good to SD. Accustomed to a 4x OLED tv, it can be shocking and VERY distracting. I'm sure it will get better, up to what customers expect and get from Amazon electronics products. ¡Vive la Firestick!
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: We used the Recast and Fire Stick for a few months then Live TV began having delays in the action. Netflix and Prime had audio but no video. We thought it might be the television so we bought a new one. We linked it to the Recast but the same problems occurred. We wasted our money not only on the Recast and Fire Stick but also on a new TV. We very rarely write reviews even though we read reviews and consider them when purchasing a product. We hope our review prevents other buyer from wasting a lot of money and experiencing frustration with the Recast and Fire Stick.
customer_reviews.author: Paige L.

customer_reviews.title: I am retiring this please do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Had installed for 3 weeks and I’m going to return it. I am constantly getting video quality errors but my old DVR never had any issues and it is the same antenna. Also it can take 30-45 seconds for a tv show to start even though the fire stick is less than 2 feet from wireless router. DVR really needs to have an HDMI our for prinary tv to eliminate the WIFI. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Experience
customer_reviews.text: As a cord-cutter I looked forward to UHD and a cost-free TV guide. For starters, these are both excellent. However, the Recast box does not maintain Wi-Fi connectivity and needs to be powered-off/on one to three times per day. This occurs when using live TV or when playing back from the DVR. Of course, this means resetting the Fire Stick as well. Streaming from Disney+ or other services doesn't seem to be affected. If I were to do it over again, I'd wait to buy the Recast box for a year or so until Amazon fixes the problem and customer reviews reflect the improvement.
customer_reviews.author: ExE Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Was wonderful when it was first released but now having trouble every Day with it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a long time Amazon prime member and Amazon user of three fire sticks. I bought the recast when it first came out in November 2018. I loved it and it worked great for me for a long time but now every day there’s a problem with it. I restart it and that doesn’t seem to take half the time. It is very buggy and desperately need a new software release. Please take some time to look into this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good but not too impressive.
customer_reviews.text: This is product is good but it could be better. If you do not have another device (firestick) then you cannot view your recordings. It would be great if you could view your recordings online while using a PC. I cannot view my recordings on my Smart TV even though I have the Prime App on it.
customer_reviews.author: Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for Prime!
customer_reviews.text: Sending the Recast back. Not sending my TiVo 1TB OTA back. The software for the Recast, as many other reviewer have noted, is very primative—-at best. Feels like only the hardware was ready to be sold. 1% of what the spectacular TiVo software can do. Recast software will undoubtly improve over time. When it does maybe I will try Recast again. And have had some strange bugs with the Recast software. Too annoying overall. Yes, there are no guide subscription fees, but TiVo just had a $50 discount on their OTA plus another $50 discount on their Lifetime subscription fee, so that is a better bargain overall for me.
customer_reviews.author: motees

customer_reviews.title: Need to Remotely reset the box to get video to play, occasional pixelation, no DVR guide from app
customer_reviews.text: The box tends to act like it is buffering to stream a show and then then get stuck about 90% in the preparation phase saying it is having an issue. If I reset the box, then, the issue goes away. I get pixelation too. Not sure if it is from the antenna or the streaming. I have not taken the time to record a show and see if the pixelation is due to the antenna (as it was recorded) or a streaming issue. Lastly, you cannot preprogram the DVR using the firestick app on my iphone. You can only record what is playing at the current time.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: It's now 100 off?
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this product on June 4. It is now July 3rd and it's 100 dollars off. It's doing what it says it will do, however, the antenna suggested that would be added was horrible. I barely get the main ABC, not NBC or CBS channel. Does not matter where I place the antenna. Same channels, just ABC. How do I get reimbursed 100? I can return the product and repurchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Honey

customer_reviews.title: Good, but needs some work
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy we got the Fire TV Recast, and it does what it’s supposed to.....BUT..... it needs some work before it’s a 5-star. It glitches and freezes quite a bit. Sometimes we can just go “back“ and then start the episode again to solve the problem. Sometimes it requires more of a “reset” than that. The user interface also needs to better. I like it a lot, but it can also be frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: jclay

customer_reviews.title: Not the best recorder in my opinion have lots of trouble with it.
customer_reviews.text: Recast works pretty good most of the time. Seems lately I have to keep unplugging it and plugging it back in to watch my recordings. Also sometimes I don't get sound from it have to keep messing with it don't think I would buy this again. Another thing is difficult to delete my recordings it keeps going back and forth and won't let me delete it I have to try over and over to try to delete something.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl K Green

customer_reviews.title: Missing Basic Features
customer_reviews.text: Despite being out since 2018, I was surprised to find out that the Recast doesn't even allow you to schedule recordings from the app. Amazon's solution is for you to drive home and use the TV remote. I can't seem to consistently delete recordings in progress from the app. Works sometimes, but not others. Picture quality can be really bad for the first few seconds, but after that it's decent. On the positive side, being able to mount the antenna and box out of the way is nice. And still beats paying for cable. Hopefully Amazon decides to support the product. My fear is they won't until they update the hardware, then expect us to shell out another $230.
customer_reviews.author: miyaker

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for TiVo!
customer_reviews.text: Received the Recast yesterday. Set it up using the new 4K Fire Stick version (replaced 2nd generation). I am using a Winegard FlatWave Amped FL5500A Digital HD Indoor Amplified TV Antenna that I purchased at Costco (best price). Put the antenna on my south facing window (facing Sutro Tower in San Francisco). I live in an apartment building in the Pacific Heights area of SF. Channel scan gave me 72 channels which is a great deal more than with TiVo Bolt channel scan! No complaints (yet anyway) and will be canceling my TiVo service next month.
customer_reviews.author: rxcats

customer_reviews.title: Still undecided after connection issues.
customer_reviews.text: At first I was very satisfied. Yesterday though after only a week, it said there was a connection issue every time I tried to delete a recorded show. After searching Google for this, it turns out to be a common problem, yet in spite of this, I was not able to find a true resolution. I unplugged everything, including the Modem, and later in the day all was fine. When it works, it is wonderful. It is too soon to guess whether this will happen again, and if so, how often. If it turns out to be rare, I will give this 5 stars, as I do like it very much. If not, it will go the other direction.
customer_reviews.author: gacleader1

customer_reviews.title: I share the content with 3 Firestick TV's in my house
customer_reviews.text: As a cable-cutter of five or six years who went to Amazon Prime for added content, the Fire TV Recast is a wonderful enhancement to my video experience. I really like being able to record and watch programs I would otherwise miss. Sharing this content with other household TV's is a great bonus. The channel guide is great and only shows me the channels I receive. I love it !
customer_reviews.author: Davedirect

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device, clearly better than many of the alternatives. Great Fire TV integration. The ONLY ONLY reason I didn't give it a 5 out of 5 stars is the disturbing lack of an inboard web page for diagnostics that shows tuner signal quality and strength. Without that it makes aiming your antenna for your favorite channels near impossible or very difficult at best. Most competing tuner devices have some form of real time diagnostics. And Amazon does not seem to be responding to a number of user inquiries about the same. Amazon, I'll be happy to change my review to a 5 of 5 if you can just get past that one hurdle.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great device for us
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in October of 2018 so we could cut the cord. The purchase was about a month before the hardware was actually released. It was super easy to install and it functioned as described from the get go. I remember a little bug as it related to using a network cable instead of connecting wireless. That was soon fixed with an update from Amazon. So we've used it daily for almost two years and we wouldn't trade it.
customer_reviews.author: Okie PJ

customer_reviews.title: Cutting the cord
customer_reviews.text: Last fall I had lost my DVR from directv. I kinda got cheap. I bought the Recast hoping to record Prime time T. So far it works well. The biggest issues are the devices (Fire TV) need to be rebooted to stream at times. My network normally does well on buffering. I love being able to ask Alexa to record a chow and it works. So the guide issues people have didn't matter to me. I love mine, you should too.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Was great, but I think we have a bug...
customer_reviews.text: 1TB/4 tuner model. This device has worked flawlessly since first setup but I think I have found a bug. Our local PBS station had a federally mandated braudcast frequency change last week, ever since, my recordings of that station have failed due to signal issues. I did a channel rescan but it looks like the recast is holding on to the original frequency. I have looked and do not see a way to delete the station. I think a developer made an assumption that a broadcast station would never change broadcast frequency... Assumptions suck. I don't want to do it but the only way I can see to resolve this issue may be to factory reset the recast box. Weak.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: OTA TV wont work without complete internet connection
customer_reviews.text: This device assumes you have high speed always on internet. If your internet connection starts to fail or goes off line (ISP down) you CANNOT watch regular over the air TV. It seems this device and the fire stick must always check in with the Amazon mother ship. Are they monitoring what you watch and how much ?? All I know is if the internet starts to hic-up you are not going to watch live TV.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Chisolm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution For Us
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted to get over the air HD signal so I could watch live sports and 'skip commercials' on the TV in a basement while maintaining a 'clean' look without big rabbit ears or covering a window up with a flat panel antenna. This fits the bill for my setup. I put the unit in an inconspicuous spot in 3rd floor (of 4 in the townhouse!) and got several more stations than I did in the basement. Plus no wires all over the wall and not blocking windows. I haven't tried nearly all of the functions of this amazing device, but it does exactly what I needed so 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Walker

product_meta.title: Fire TV Recast | Record over-the-air TV | 500 GB DVR | 75 hours
feature_bullets: Fire TV Recast is a DVR that lets you watch and record over-the-air TV at home with Fire TV or Echo Show, or on-the-go with a compatible mobile device—with no monthly fees.
Enjoy live sports, local news, late night shows, and other can’t miss TV from channels available through an HD antenna (sold separately).
Record up to 2 shows at once. Plus, store up to 75 hours of HD programming.
With a compatible Alexa-enabled device, use your voice to search for shows, control the channel guide, and manage recordings.
The most reliable video streams over Wi-Fi of any over-the-air DVR.
